alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Blaine (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Blaine. In western Oklahoma, Beckham, Custer, Roger Mills and Washita. * WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to thunderstorms. Emergency management had reported multiple roads closed near Clinton and Arapaho earlier this evening. Do not drive through flooded roadways. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Thomas, Arapaho, Hammon, Canute, Custer City, Butler, Foss, Strong City, Foss Reservoir, Moorewood and Stafford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
